overview_summary: Three neighboring landowning parties were identified, and none have a documented stance on development (all are noted as unknown). One neighbor is a high-profile community member due to an elected park board position, while the other two have low public profiles or influence.

neighbors.name: Tommy L. Wyrick & Diane M. Wyrick
neighbors.claims: Tommy L. Wyrick (born 1946) and Diane M. Wyrick (born 1952) are in their 70s and listed at a Rochelle, Illinois address ([truepeoplesearch.net](https://truepeoplesearch.net/people/diane-wyrick#:~:text=Lives%3A)). They own multiple parcels in Ogle County, but no records show them holding any public office or speaking in local meetings (indicating a low public profile).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out directly via mail or phone, recognizing their long-term ownership. Emphasize respect for their land and assure that any development would preserve the farmland’s value and legacy.

neighbors.name: Reed W. Harris, Trustee
neighbors.claims: Reed W. Harris, 74, is the listed trustee for this property’s ownership ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/reed-harris#:~:text=Reed%20W%20Harris%20is%20a,addresses%20for%20Reed%20W%20Harris)). Before moving to rural Rochelle, he lived in several other states (including Texas and Kansas) ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/reed-harris#:~:text=16003%20E%20Bethel%20Rd%2C%20Rochelle%2C,current%20address)). His Ogle County land is held via a trust, and there’s no public record of him engaging in local civic activities or development issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Harris in a one-on-one setting, providing clear information about the project’s local impact. Since he lacks deep community ties, focus on factual benefits (like property tax relief or land-use flexibility) to address any concerns.

neighbors.name: Brent T. Carmichael & Danielle M. Carmichael
neighbors.claims: Brent T. Carmichael serves as the Secretary of the Flagg-Rochelle Park District Board, an elected position on the 7-member park board ([www.rochelleparkdistrict.org](https://www.rochelleparkdistrict.org/board-of-commissioners#:~:text=)) ([www.rochelleparkdistrict.org](https://www.rochelleparkdistrict.org/board-of-commissioners#:~:text=%2A%20BT%20Carmichael%20)). The Carmichael family has deep roots in Ogle County’s farming community, noted for multi-generational involvement in local civic and charitable organizations ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/leonard-carmichael-obituary?id=28064753#:~:text=match%20at%20L110%20Carmichael%20family,a%20legacy%2C%20keep%20it%20going)) ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/rrstar/name/leonard-carmichael-obituary?id=28064753#:~:text=Dear%20Carmichael%20Family%20I%20am,are%20discussing%20the%20matter%20now)). No specific public statements from Brent or Danielle about development or energy projects were found in local news or records.
neighbors.influence_justification: Park board official; prominent farm family

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Brent Carmichael through community channels — for example, via another respected local leader or a park board colleague. Highlight how the project aligns with community benefits (e.g., supporting local services or recreation through tax revenue) and seek his guidance on addressing any community concerns.
